text.section:
Each amusement owner who operates an amusement attraction in the State shall:
keep and make available to the Commissioner records about the activities of the amusement owner under this title; and
keep accurate records of, and submit periodic reports to the Commissioner on, injuries to the public that occur during use of amusement attractions other than injuries that:
are minor;
require only first-aid treatment; and
do not involve medical treatment or loss of consciousness.

Whenever a death or serious physical injury results from the operation of an amusement attraction:
the person who directly controls the operation of the amusement attraction immediately shall close the amusement attraction until it has been inspected by the Commissioner;
the amusement owner shall report the incident orally or in writing to the Commissioner within 24 hours; and
the Commissioner shall inspect the amusement attraction within 24 hours after receiving notice of the incident.
